snippet: The yeast-storing utility of otherwise pesky wasps and hornets holds a larger lesson about creatures that we perceive as objectionable.
abstract: Study in The Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences finds that European hornets and paper wasps incubate the S cerevisiae yeast strain in their stomachs during the winter, allowing it to survive and spread geographically; yeast strain is particularly important in the making of wine; wasp's utility holds a larger lesson for humans preoccupied with why creatures they perceive as objectionable exist.
lead_paragraph: The yeast-storing utility of otherwise pesky wasps and hornets holds a larger lesson about creatures that we perceive as objectionable.

headline.print_headline: Don’t Swat That Bug! It May Be Working on Next Year’s Vintage
headline.main: Don’t Swat That Bug! It May Be Working on Next Year’s Vintage
